results.title: Elephants: their last stand
results.brief_description: This film is about the conflict between people and elephants. In the Samburu district of Kenya, herds of elephants have raided farms, trampled crops and imperilled a struggling people’s way of life. Unfortunately there is no easy solution to the problem of whether to eliminate the elephants or to protect them as part of the country’s unique heritage.

results.title: Elephants
results.brief_description: The setting of this film is a farm where elephants are trained as circus performers. The animals are shown eating, bathing and doing their tricks.

results.title: Elephant theatre (K)
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Sabrina Schmid
results.brief_description: One man has built a little theatre which he can hold in the palm of his hand. It reveals a world of its own. Yet there remains one dream to be fulfilled: that some elephants will come to live in it.

results.brief_description: Like an Indian pod filled with tiny ivory elephants, the imaginary hand-size theatre fills with elephants, to the delight of the man who built it.

results.title: Elephant baby
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a baby elephant from its first day in the jungle, through many weeks of training, to the day it joins a working force of elephants in a lumber camp. Photographed in Mysore, India, the film gives an account of the daily activities of working elephants and of the people who train them, including the shooting of a tiger which came too close to the camp for comfort.

results.title: Elephant
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Peter Chermayeff
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the African elephant on its daily routine of foraging, dusting, playing, roaming anddrinking from a waterhole. Illustrates the elephants physical characteristics. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Elements, compounds and mixtures
results.creator_credit: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
Every element in the periodic table is made up of atoms, and every atom in an element contains the same number of protons. This program examines how elements combine in mixtures, compounds and solutions to make up the world in which we live. Students are taken on a fun journey, using real-life examples to explain the properties of elements, as well as concepts such as chemical bonding and heterogenous/homogenous mixtures. Suitable for Upper primary/lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media

results.title: Elements organised: the periodic table
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC, Tony Jolly and David Jackson
results.brief_description: A series of excellent demonstrations, with graphics, showing how the great variety in the behaviour of the elements can be organised into a systematic structure, the Periodic Table. Please note that there is some background noise on the tape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
